text: Governor's Bridge in 2007 Governor's Bridge is a road bridge in Stranmillis, south Belfast. It was inaugurated on the 23rd of September 1974. The bridge forms part of a one-way system along with the neighbouring King's Bridge. Together they connect the Stranmillis and Annadale Embankments, with Governor's Bridge carrying traffic from the latter to the former. ==References== Category:Bridges in Northern Ireland Category:Buildings and structures in Belfast
title: Governor's Bridge, Belfast
